intro: Argostemma teysmannianum, commonly known as the broad-leaved argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
